Sorry, but you did that yourself.

There are no less than THREE roles with high Roaming potential - the midlaner, who has a position advantage to leave lane and quickly gank. The jungler, who is often outside of enemy vision and can make picks, and the support, who doesn't require CS and can therefore easily leave lane to aid others. Supports have been involved in roaming since S1, and just because it's no longer common doesn't mean someone SHOULDN'T do it. If you abandon your ADC to a poor lane position, yes, their death could be your fault. However, far more common is the support telling the ADC to play safe, leaving lane to roam, and the ADC then attempting to skirmish as though the support had not left.

If you only roam to try and help a 2v4 mid, by the time you get there you'll just be giving a third kill to the enemy team.

I play support and ADC
Supports aren't maids.
At least since Nidalee stopped being played support.

Supports rarely roam because most adc's aren't smart enough to utilize wave control or playing safe. If ym adc has pushed the wave into tower and decides to back the first thing I do is look at mid to see if I can roam effectively to help. If not, I ward really quick if I have Sightstone wards left and back.

If we just reamed bot lane and got the double kill, I roam the river to check for jungler and then hit mid as the adc backs, takes tower or follows. 

Roaming is a HUGE part of being a good support because you don't need CS so missing a wave isn't going to hurt you AND it funnels all the xp from your adc's csing into your adc. It can also secure mid lane kills and objectives. It requires your adc not being garbage and being able to make smart choices. Most adc's tunnel vision on cs and don't see anything else. I don't blame them. CSing isn't always easy when you're also watching for a gank, looking for an in on your opposing duo and being wary of enemy initiation. But if you just killed bot lane and the jungler is top then you can bet your butt I am roaming mid.

Supports should roam. They just should. However, they need to pick the right times and the adc should eb creating lulls where this is doable for mid lane.

In my experience as a support main, you roam in 4 instances
1: Both enemy bot laners are dead
2: Enemy ADC is dead.
3: ADC has gone to base, and enemies are low
4: Your ADC is a world-class goof and has pushed like crazy without waiting for you.
Always #4.

The key is limiting that time and making good use of it.

Remember, a support's kit is useful in other lanes as well. Forcing a surprise 1v2 on another lane, while your ADC *knows* they're going to be on a 1v2 and play defensive until you're back. The key difference is the lane you're ganking has no idea the support is coming, especially if vision control is in your favor, whereas the ADC should know that they're going to be alone and adjust their playstyle accordingly.

It's difficult, but keep in mind that you have to be independent at times, like when the support dies or has to recall. 

It's not like we just go to mid/top and just stay there (unless the ADC is toxic). We go where we needed for a quick job (secure an objective or gank a lane) and then usually head back to bot lane. Think of it like we're out warding, except it takes just a little bit longer.
